message:
واحد بيسأل: ايه اكبر mind fuck ever. 
بصراحه مش عارف ترجمه مناسبه للتعبير mind fuck بس تقدر تقول ان المقصود بيه حقيقة او معلومة تخلي دماغك تدوخ من كتر ما هي صادمه. 
المهم، واحد جاوب اجابه بسيطه بس فعلا صادمه لو فكرت فيها، اسيبكم مع الإجابه :)
story: Mohammed El Sayed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: What is the biggest mindfuck ever?
caption: quora.com
description: Sreenidhi Anand's answer: Consider a 256 pixels wide, 256 pixels tall greyscale image like below A greyscale image has a byte of storage for every pixel, so every pixel can range in value from 0 (being completely black) to 255 (being completely white), totally 256 values. There are 256*256 = 65...

data.message: Something that will blow your mind
How about the fact that this (1+2+3+4+5+...till infinity) is -1/12 ?
What if we reduced the number of pixels to 40*40 it will give us a sum of  (1.46150164E+128), BTW the number mentioned in the article should written like (65536^256).
Mohamed Hashem Mohamed Helmy Mina Fared Khaled Moheb Ahmed Mohi

the real problem is that we can't determine what is determined as a correct image , we can even reduce the number having a range acceptable signal to noise ratio
for example the same image would be generated 1000 times for different acceptable snr
so reducing the image size to 40x40 as  mentioned by Hossam Rehan Then accepting up to 1000 snr for the exact same image 
Then reducing the number again for 20 poses per person 
What else can we reduce to have the person image :D ?
That would be 1/(7.3e+123) probalility still pretty bad

It's not entirely mind-blowing though, because of the small size of the image (low resolution), different things can lead to the same image, an example would be an image of someone's birthday can look exactly the same as someone else's birthday (details of faces and so on are too small to be captured).
What is more mind-blowing ... is pi!
Pi goes on forever and contains all possible combinations of numbers of any size. If can take the digits of pi and turn them to binary and interpret them as bitmap images of different sizes (mesh bas 256x256) you will find photos of everything at all possible resolutions (levels of detail). You can find a 20 Megapixel image of you standing on Mars (doesn't matter if this never happens in real life). Anything and Everything!

if we assumed that we have a machine that can brute force all these possibilities for coloring images and ignoring noise images so we can see the real past and future ? i don't think it's that easy :D

This is a better version of it
https://youtu.be/yGmYCfWyVAM
you can't build script to generate them? and use face recognition software to delete the useless images and just keep the faces photos :D
The number approaches infinity that decoding our dna pool and extracting all of the human possibilities would be a walk in the park in comparison
a proper translation would be the term that unfortunately became common recently ف** الأفكار
An event with probabilty of zero in some systems doesn't mean it is never going to occur .. there are events with probabilty of zero yet they may occur normaly😃... this was mind blowing to me
